title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Not recognizing SSD
message:
Tricky one here.

Customer Stated that it did not recognize SSD and Thunderbolt Ethernet does not work. Works fine on external drives and thunderbolt does work for display, Just not ethernet. I have a feeling these are connected and its an issue with PCIE. SSD Reset L is at 3.3v and i have 3.3V at L4500 and at the Connector. I have .4v on PCIE_CLK100M_SSD_P and N. [Can anyone confirm this is correct? i feel it should be at the same Voltage as the rest of the logic] and 3.3V on SSD_CLKREQ_L. SATA_PCIE_SEL is at 3.05V that seems low to me, but I'm unsure.

I Looked up u4510 and it seems to be getting correct voltage but when i look at the data sheet it says SEL needs to be Low to Run in PCIE mode. is that what I'm missing here? i thought these SSDs used PCIE not Sata. I also checked XSD and it is low as it should be.

Any Ideas on what to check next?

thanks

U4500 Data Sheet
[url]https://www.nxp.com/docs/en/data-sheet/CBTL02043A_CBTL02043B.pdf[/url]

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Not recognizing SSD
message: Is there any history? Did this "just" happen? Diode mode on both sides of C4510/11/15/16?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Not recognizing SSD
message: It was a return repair from another store. Actually just got this one sorted. After spending a ridiculous amount of time trying to troubleshoot the SSD not being recognized checked all pice lines and clocks, Replaced U4510. Was about to quit. I then realized the customers SSD and Mine was formatted for APFS. For some reason this machine would not recognize it with that format. Erased to HFS and is recognized fine. Could never recreate the thunderbolt issue here in store. Close this please. Thank you.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Not recognizing SSD
message: BIOS needs an update for APFS to work. If you swap an APFS formatted SSD into a board that did not have the update it will not boot from it.
